h2.title: Why Convert PNG to BMP?
h2.description:
BMP is a simple raster format that stores pixels without compression — useful for certain workflows:

  • No new artifacts: Keep pixels intact for low-level editing.
  • Straightforward structure: Easy for programs to read and manipulate.
  • Legacy/embedded apps: Some Windows tools prefer BMP.

h2.title: How to Convert PNG to BMP Online
h2.description:
1. Click Upload PNG and select your file.
  2. Wait for processing to complete.
  3. Click Download BMP to save your image.

Defaults to 24-bit BMP with no compression.

h2.title: BMP vs PNG Comparison
h2.description:
• File Size: BMP is typically much larger than PNG.
  • Quality: Both are lossless (BMP uncompressed; PNG lossless compressed).
  • Transparency: PNG supports alpha; common 24-bit BMP does not.
  • Compression: BMP none; PNG lossless DEFLATE.
  • Use Cases: BMP for legacy/pixel ops; PNG for web and efficient lossless storage.

h2.title: Supported Limits & Formats
h2.description:
• Accepted input: PNG (image/png)
  • Maximum file size: up to 16 MB per file
  • Output: BMP (.bmp, MIME image/bmp)
  • Bit depth: 24-bit (no alpha)

h2.title: Troubleshooting
h2.description:
• Very large output: BMP is uncompressed; for smaller lossless, keep PNG.
  • Need transparency: BMP 24-bit has no alpha; stay with PNG.
  • Upload fails: Ensure the file is PNG and ≤ 16 MB.

faq.question: Will BMP work on all applications?
faq.answer: BMP is widely supported on Windows and recognized by many other platforms. Modern web workflows usually prefer PNG/WebP for size efficiency.

faq.question: How much larger are BMP files compared to PNG?
faq.answer: Often several times larger (e.g., 3–10× or more), because BMP is uncompressed.

faq.question: What file sizes are supported?
faq.answer: You can upload images up to 16 MB per file.

faq.question: Are my files safe?
faq.answer: Files are processed automatically and not retained longer than necessary for conversion.

faq.question: Can I convert multiple PNGs at once?
faq.answer: This page converts one file at a time. For bulk needs, repeat the process or use a batch tool.

faq.question: Does BMP support transparency?
faq.answer: Standard 24-bit BMP doesn’t include alpha. Use PNG for transparency.

note: BMP output is intentionally large (uncompressed). For web delivery, prefer PNG/WebP/AVIF.
